SortAlgDemo

Class SortVisualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • javax.swing.JApplet
              • SortAlgDemo.SortVisualizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer

    public class SortVisualizer
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    The SortVisualizer class is the main GUI. It is capable to handle all users's input, and displays graphical sorting results. It is the top level ancestor of all the other classes (the entry point of the software). It will initialize a SortTimer and a SortHandler object when users trigger a new sorting demo as its global variable, this class should have full access to the timer and handler so as to gain control on the execution of the entire sorting process.
    For example, pause the sorting, continue the sorting, and terminate the sorting.

      • sortingAlg

        private int sortingAlg
        A private integer which indicate the selected sorting algorithm.
        0 - Insertion Sort
        1 - Shell Sort
        2 - Quick Sort
        3 - Merge Sort

      • sortingDataNo

        private int sortingDataNo
        A private integer which indicate the selected number of data being sorted.

      • sortingOrder

        private int sortingOrder
        A private integer which indicate the selected initial ordering of data being sorted.
        0 - Increasing Order
        1 - Decreasing Order
        2 - Random Order
        3 - Nearly Sorted

      • sortingSpeed

        private int sortingSpeed
        A private integer which indicate the selected sorting speed.
        0 - Step
        1 - Slow
        2 - Medium
        3 - Fast

        private SortTimer st
        A private SortTimer object.

      • windowActivated

        public void windowActivated(java.awt.event.WindowEvent we)
        A public method to put a listener on the window activated state.

        If the WindowEvent is came from the main GUI - SortVisualizer and if the jdgConfig is not null, we will display the configuration menu.

        The part is relevant since we observe a behavior that if the browser window (which contain the JApplet) is minimized, then the JDialog box invoked by the JApplet will not be activated after the browser window is maximized, this could cause problem that our user may not get back the control properly especially if the JDialog box is set to Modal.

        Not sure if this is a bug of the JDialog in JDK.

        Specified by:
        windowActivated in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
        Parameters:
        we - the corresponding WindowEvent

      • warning

        public boolean warning(java.lang.String opt)
        A public method to display a warning message.

        Parameters:
        opt - the message text to be shown.
        Returns:
        true if the OK button of the message box is clicked, else return false if the CANCEL button is clicked.

      • setupTheme

        private void setupTheme()
        A private method to setup the color theme of the GUI.

        It will instantiate the SortVisualizer_UIColor and apply this theme into the GUI.

      • configDemo

        private void configDemo()
        A private method to display the configuration menu.

      • beginSorting

        public void beginSorting()
        A public method to begin the sorting operation.

        When invoked, it will instantiate a SortTimer object which will be later used to track everything happend during the sorting operation.

      • finishSorting

        public void finishSorting(long elapsedTime)
        A public method to indicate the completion of the sorting operation.

        Upon the completion, it will also invoke a Garbage Collection to try release un-used memory.

        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the total time spent (of primitive data type long) on the sorting operation .

      • drawChart

        public void drawChart(java.lang.Comparable[] c,
                      int comparisonCount,
                      int swapCount)
        A public method to display the current sorting operation in bar charts.

        It will instantiate a barChart object which returns a JPanel contain the graphics to be display.

        Parameters:
        c - the data container which holds the current ordering of the data being sorted.
        comparisonCount - the counter which holds the no. of comparison occured.
        swapCount - the counter which holds the no. of data swapping occured.
